reviews.text: The center is a wonderful resource for the University, as well as, the community. It offers diverse resources for those interested in local culture and state history. The names of those instrumental in creating and maintaining the facility are notable.  Make time and treat yourself to a visit.

There is a very nice playground. The playground also has a handicap accessible swing for children. You can see a life sized fighter helicopter & little memorial. WaveTech is also located within this park.
Save-a-lot of my go-to grocery store. Excellent food at great prices.
I would have given five stars but people were driving very fast and I was almost hit twice!! I don’t feel very safe
Great place for kids & pets!
Best dog park in town
Great family place to go especially when they are doing the frontier reenactments, like today.
This is truly a historical place,and the school of longhunter fabulous ! Seen people i met at other places before,as well as mafe new friends too ! Memories will last a life time !!!
It's a small but nice park. I recommend checking out for a little bit ifyou are pasding through.

The staff is very knowledgeable and good at answering questions. The museum upstairs the gift shop has a ton of great information and artifacts. After the rain stopped we toured the fort, enjoyed the trading post and the items they had for sale that have been made within the fort.
Very nice and we'll maintained.

My wife, son, and I had dinner there yesterday evening.  First time for my wife and I.  What a great experience!  The food was absolutely delicious!  I've eaten a lot of rib eye steaks in my 63 years, but not many have even come close to the best one that I had last night.  The appetizer (calamari) also ranked as the best.  Even the spinach salad was top-notch.  It looked like they had just picked the spinach from an award-winning plant....it was that fresh!

The service was also first-class, with just the right amount of attention given to us.  Erica, the owner and also the cook, even took time for some casual conversation, which was delightful, as well.  We even learned that she has a special relationship with Sonny Bono. :-)

Last but not least, after commenting on how good the meal was, and mentioning the bread, she went back to the kitchen and got us a fresh loaf, wrapped it in foil, and sent it home with us.

So, obviously I would highly recommend the Aquarium Lounge.  And no....we're not related, nor was I paid, or even encouraged to write a review. It was just that good!  :-)
When we go it's always good. Portions we're reasonable and our waitress was excellent!!!
Nice glass of pinot noir,  filet mignon cooked well, great service.  Perfect place for a special night!❤
We celebrated our 10 Valentine's day together. Everything was excellent.
Great food, awesome atmosphere! Highly recommend!

We live in another state so we had to have these pepperoni rolls shipped to us. I have to say that theyre delicious but I think there was more bread than pepperoni.
 We think they should add a little more pepperoni since that is the main reason that we ordered them.  This is also the first time that we’ve ever tasted pepperoni rolls from West Virginia and  since we saw this place on TV and everyone was raving about it, we set our expectations pretty high. We will probably order them again but maybe ask for extra pepperoni since its so good.

Country Club Bakery has the best pepperoni rolls. I'll stop on my way to work and get some for work. I'm the envy of everyone around me. The smell brightens up the atmosphere. The price is very reasonable for the quality of food you get as a customer. You're always greated with a friendly smile from the nice ladies at the front counter. Any other pepperoni roll is sub standard compared to those at Country Club Bakery.
Loved this place growing up, almost ate here 5 times a week 1987 through 1990. Hope it is the same or better now, when ever I here someone is in town I ask them to bring thos back with them.
Got some fresh cookies today definitely recommend the raspberry filled❤ also one of the best places to get pepperoni rolls!
Great pepperoni rolls!

This place has wonderful food. I've never been disappointed in anything I've ordered. Friendly service and affordable prices. It is small and lunch time is busy but that is part of the experience. It is a charming place to meet up with friends.
Great home cooked meals and friendly service! You can't go wrong eating here! Fried chicken, steak salad, hot Italian pasta salad, pork barbecue,  chicken fried steak, philly steak sandwich...
Hot pasta salad is fantastic! Service is great. Atmosphere is good for lunch or dinner.
Excellent home cooked food. Never disappointed. Awesome family, friendly Christian business.
Loved the food and the service. Great prices.

Our number one choice for Mexican food is Taqueria Mi Puebla! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu (steak and shrimp street tacos pictured) because it is all so good! The service is great even when they are packed and you can't go wrong with the atmosphere! You wont be disappointed if you decide to try them for yourself!

I have been here at least 20 times would give Taqueria Mi Pueblo five stars easily. But they almost always fall short with the hostess and waitresses. Especially the head hostess. The lady who takes you to a table has a bad attitude. AlWAYS .One of the experiences of going to a good ,well ran restaurant is to have good service .Smiles ,a good attitude, small talk.Best food in the world and snotty bad attitudes just don't mix. 3 and a half Stars. Would come more often if they would only have a better attitude. Never hello ,never how are you, not even a thank you while paying or leaving. I really like the food.so I don't say anything. I don't want to get 86 from the place you know what I mean.
Omg food was great. It's real authentic Mexican food and is great... Great drinks as well. The mango margarita is a must. Great customer service too!!! This is my new restaurant

The margaritas are huge, tasty, and cheap!! The delicous Paloma had me a little tipsy restaurant despite it's somewhat small size and was cheap so I still give it 5 stars. Fajitas were grilled to perfection. Great prices for everything!! Loved the regular salsa but the hot salsa has an intense cilantro flavor so if you're not a fan of cilantro I'd skip the hot salsa. This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant

I have been eating at this restaurant since the owner grilled the food on the sidewalk. I've watched this place grow into what it is over the years and have supported the owner financially as a loyal customer. However, I will never eat here again due to the simple fact that there is "resist" art in the vestibule area of the restaurant. As a proud American and supporter of our president, I do not feel welcome eating at a restaurant that supports the "resist" movement.

Hats off to the employees!!!  Great service on a very busy day... The food was absolutely wonderful!  Got seated fast and the ice cream was delicious.  Every desert that came out had to get its own picture!  Great service.
Service was excellent. My family and myself stopped in to see what it was all about. You definitely get your money's worth and more. The kids loved it. Food is delicious.
What a great place with great food and the best staff.  Good luck eating a single scoop of ice cream!! Definitely worth the trip from Kentucky
Good diner food in the area.  Desserts are amazing and worth leaving room for.  I'd go for dessert even over the food itself.
Great food. Great service. Wonderful atmosphere. If you want a dessert that is also a work of art, come here!
I had the loaded French fries and they were excellent.
When we are in the area we always eat here. Share fries are delicious, great subs and they are always very nice. Great service.
Very good food and fairly fast drive thru.
Very clean with great workers. I got the buffalo sub just good .

Very good. They cook the ingredients in front of you like a Japanese steakhouse so you know the food is really fresh. It's very filling even ordering the small sandwich had 2 meals in one. Bonus for Fairmont State students there is a 10% discount at this specific restaurant. Preparers were very friendly too.

The food tastes okay but the prices are absolutely outrageous. My fiance sand I had a date night and for two drinks two burritos two fries and a bag of cinnamon chips it was $30. You can do way better at any of the actual Mexican restaurants in the area.

We use to love this place... been coming for years.. but the good got smaller and smaller and more expensive, was always cold... So quit going. 

Started back and it seems better. I always AK them to put done may in it D they do, ask them to make sure its warm.. and they do..w appreciate it.👍
Service today was excellent and great personality.  Food seemed to taste better too!  Always a favorite for me and the wife when in Fairmont.

Hard to give this less than 4 stars as it's a place of the past and brings back lots of memories from Friday nights after football games and hanging out with friends. If you've never eaten here before and aren't local to the area, I would give it 3 maybe even only two stars. The food is mediocre at best but for a lifetime local like myself and others its iconic and brings back memories and thus gets four stars from me. The breaded mushrooms are really good and the fries and blue are top of the line however the burritos and tacos are runny and have a so-so taste. The wings are typically a little on the dry side and swimming in sauce and nothing to brag about.   Prices are a bit on the high side for what you get,  but as I said it's really about atmosphere and memories and therefore the only reason I give it 4 stars.
Pricey for what it is..Bay fries. Ok..hot wings weren't hott at all! Charge like crazy for a dab of blue cheese..a 3.5
